div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the District of Washington
In Re Application of D.A. Hatfield, for writ of Habeas Corpus. vs. No. 2082
Witness my hand and offical seal this 10 day of May 1913
In the matter of D.A. Hatfield, for application for Writ of Habeas Corpus.

On the 6th day of Feburary, this cause came on to be heard on the application of D. A. Hatfield for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and the answer thereto of Robert T. Hodge, Respondent, and after hearing arguments in behalf of the Respondent by his Attorney, Hugh M. Caldwell, the further hearing was continued until the 24th day of Feburary, 1912, and after hearing arguments in behalf of the petitioner by his attorney A. G. McBride and the Court being sufficiently advised in the premises, the said application is denied and the Court refuses to grant a Writ of Habeas Corpus, which ruling of the Court the petitioner excepts and his exception is allowed by the Court.
